vevents.description:
Description:Want to challenge yourself to run a 5k? The run club will be set up as a beginner 5k prep group that will meet 1-2 times a week and complete runs/routes ranging from 1-4mi to help prepare participants for the Bernicks Rock Your Sole 5k on August 8th.
Overview:On Mondays the group will meet at 7am at the Campus Recreationguest services desk (www5.stcloudstate.edu/campusmap). In the event the building is closed the group will meet in front of the Herb Brooks Hockey Center. The Saturday routes will consist of more social/scenic runs meeting at various locations\, like Quarry Park\, Sauk Rapids River Fest\, and more. The Saturday runs will take place at 9am or at other times if specified in advance.
Schedule (please check Facebook or our social media for any schedule updates):

Saturday\, June 29th9am (Carly)
No Club Week of the 1st
Monday\, July 8th7am (Taylor/Carly)
Saturday\, July 13th9am (Taylor?/Carly)
Monday\, July 15th7am (Taylor/Carly)
Saturday\, July 20th9am (Taylor?/Carly)
Monday\, July 22nd7am (Taylor/Carly)
Saturday\, July 27th9am (Taylor?/Carly)
Monday\, July 29th7am (Taylor/Carly)
Saturday\, August 3rd9am Quarry Park (Taylor?/Carly)
Monday\, August 5th7am (Taylor/Carly)
Saturday\, August 10thRock Your Sole 5k
Communication:
 Snapchat: scsurec
  Instagram: scsufitness
  Facebook: scsufitness
Primary Contacts: Taylor Ullmann (tsullmann@stcloudstate.edu) & Carly McNiece (cmcniece@stcloudstate.edu)
Hosted by: Campus Recreation
Additional Information can be found at: https://huskiesconnect.stcloudstate.edu/event/4188870

Link:SCSU Group Exercise
Description: Exhilarate your body and mind with Yoga. Yoga instruction will emphasize safe alignment in postures\, while enhancing whole-body strength\, flexibility\, and balance. Classes include centering\, warm-ups\, sun salutations\, standing and seated poses\, and relaxation. Bring your practice alive and meet new people along the way!
Summer Session #2 Group Exercise Classes: July 9th- August 15th. All classes located in either Studio #53 or #51 in the SCSU Student Recreation Center.
Pro-rated summer membership: $20 (includes access to the Fitness center)
Hosted by: Campus Recreation
Additional Information can be found at: https://huskiesconnect.stcloudstate.edu/event/4188882

Link:SCSU Group Exercise
Description:Fun and done! Training sessions last just 30 minutes! Get in\, get fit\, and get on with your day. Each express class is designed for maximum results in minimum time. Having a rough day? Guaranteed to work the crabby out of you!
Summer Session #2 Group Exercise Classes: July 9th- August 15th. All classes located in either Studio #53 or #51 in the SCSU Student Recreation Center.
Pro-rated summer membership: $20 (includes access to the Fitness center)
Hosted by: Campus Recreation

Gain admission into the law school of your choice knowing you have mastered the skills needed to succeed. Our LSAT prep course and free strategy workshop prepare you to take the test with confidence.
Our strategy session is an informative introduction with some helpful tips for any student or member of public considering law school.
Our intensive\, 30-hour prep program uses proven techniques and questions from actual LSAT exams to make your experience as close to the real test as possible.
LSAT is administered four times annually. We recommend students take our LSAT prep course as close to their chosen exam date as possible. A valid LSAT score is required at all American Bar Association certified law schools.

June 4 - July 11\, Tuesdays and Thursdays\, 8-11 p.m. (no class July 2\, 4)
Cost:$849
Contact:Angie Olsontestprep@scsutraining.comor 320-308-6160


http://www.scsutraining.com/lsat
Hosted by: Center for Continuing Studies
Additional Information can be found at: https://huskiesconnect.stcloudstate.edu/event/3427150
vevents.location: St. Cloud State University Welcome Center

When you're ready for graduate school we can help you take the right steps toward your advanced degree.
Our GRE Prep course will give you the skills and confidence to maximize your performance on the GRE revised General Test. Our proven study plan covers the key sections of analytical writing\, verbal reasoning and quantitative reasoning.
We recommend the course for those who want an advanced degree in a specialized field -- education\, medicine\, social work\, public administration and business -- within the next five years. Many MBA programs now accept the GRE. It's perfect for those who want to return to school\, recent graduates and undergraduates looking for help with the complex quantitative and verbal skills needed to succeed on the GRE.

June 19-July 17\, Mondays and Wednesdays\, 6-9 p.m. (no class July 3)

Contact:Angie Olsontestprep@scsutraining.comor 320-308-6160
To register click here: www.scsutraining.com/gre
Hosted by: Center for Continuing Studies
Additional Information can be found at: https://huskiesconnect.stcloudstate.edu/event/3456452
vevents.location: St. Cloud State University Welcome Center

vevents.description: This workshop is designed for secondary and post-secondary instructors teaching in STEM related disciplines looking at UAS and GIT program and courseware development.The workshop will focus on practical industry applications for Drones and Geospatial Technology. Weather pending\, participants will conduct field operations and data collection. Ongoing applied research projects will provide examples of how drones and geospatial technology are used. Pix4D software will be utilized in the processing of digital imagery.Register by July 4\, 2019. Visit https://scsu.mn/2IRYqiL for more information and to register.\nHosted by: School of Public Affairs\nAdditional Information can be found at: https://huskiesconnect.stcloudstate.edu/event/3375648

Link:SCSU Group Exercise
Description:Has your hectic schedule thrown you off of your fitness goals? Are you looking for motivation and a routine? Got 45 minutes? In this fast paced circuit class you will enhance your cardiovascular and muscular endurance! You will be instructed to rotate through 5-6 stations\, each exercise will be timed for 35-45 sections. Cardio busrts include Rowing\, Skiing\, and Biking. Take thePower 45seven week challenge. Effective\, Simple\, & FUN!
Summer Session #2 Group Exercise Classes: July 9th- August 15th. All classes located in either Studio #53 or #51 in the SCSU Student Recreation Center.
Pro-rated summer membership: $20 (includes access to the Fitness center)
Hosted by: Campus Recreation
Additional Information can be found at: https://huskiesconnect.stcloudstate.edu/event/4188894

Link:SCSU Group Exercise
Description:Stop counting the reps. Start training to the beat. STRONG by Zumba combines body weight\, muscle conditioning\, cardio\, and plyometric training moves synced to original music that has been specifically designed to match every single move. In each class you'll burn calories while toning arms\, legs\, abs\, and glutes. Plyometic or explosive moves like high knees\, burpees\, and jumping jacks are interchanged with isometric moves like lunges\, squats\, and kickboxing.
Summer Session #2 Group Exercise Classes: July 9th- August 15th. All classes located in either Studio #53 or #51 in the SCSU Student Recreation Center.
Pro-rated summer membership: $20 (includes access to the Fitness center)
Hosted by: Campus Recreation
Additional Information can be found at: https://huskiesconnect.stcloudstate.edu/event/4188905
vevents.summary: Strong by Zumba- SCSU Group Exercise

Summer Session #2 Group Exercise Classes: July 9th- August 15th. All classes located in either Studio #53 or #51 in the SCSU Student Recreation Center.
Pro-rated summer membership: $20 (includes access to the Fitness center)
Hosted by: Campus Recreation
Additional Information can be found at: https://huskiesconnect.stcloudstate.edu/event/4188907

St. Cloud State Universitys email and Office 365 services are moving to Minnesota States Shared Tenant as a part of a system-wide effort to combine Microsoft features and services.
The transition will begin on Aug. 9\, and is expected to last approximately three days. Email and Office 365 will be unavailable during this time period.
After this transition the following Office 365 login and email changes will take affect:

Your login for email and Office 365 will change to: StarID@go.minnstate.edu
Your email address will change from @stcloudstate.edu to @go.stcloudstate.edu
Your StarID and password will stay the same

For additional information\, see stcloudstate.edu/its/office-365. Questions? Contact HuskyTech
Hosted by: Information Technology Services
Additional Information can be found at: https://huskiesconnect.stcloudstate.edu/event/3427162

All new graduate assistants are expected to attend orientation.
Orientation goals
Graduate assistants who complete orientation will:

Be able to locate and articulate policies affecting graduate assistantship employment.
Articulate the roles and responsibilities of graduate assistants on campus.
Define and provide examples of professional behavior.
Articulate the resources available to graduate assistants.


Hosted by: School of Graduate Studies
Additional Information can be found at: https://huskiesconnect.stcloudstate.edu/event/2372110

The Husky Sports Band starts the year off early with Band Camp\, Sunday\, Aug. 18th\, through Wednesday\, Aug. 21st. As a registered memberof the band\, students are eligible for early dorm check-in on Sunday! There is no audition to join\, and we welcome all students interested in woodwinds\, brass\, drumline\, and colorguard. Regardless of previous band experience\, we will help everyone get up to speed in a fun\, team-based environment! Register now for MUSP 168 - ID 000433. Contact Mr. Tharon Knowlton\, Director of the Husky Sports Band for more information: tjknowlton@stcloudstate.edu.\nHosted by: Department of Music\, School of the Arts\nAdditional Information can be found at: https://huskiesconnect.stcloudstate.edu/event/3857625

vevents.description:
All new\, undergraduate students will check-in for Huskies 1st Four Days\, the St. Cloud State orientation program\, with our Orientation Staff. Stop intoAtwood Memorial Center with your Student ID card to pick up your t-shirt\, schedule\, and information for the next four days.

Students living on-campus: Check into Huskies 1st Four Days after settling into your residence hall room.
Students living off-campus: Check into orientation any time on Thursday.

Hosted by: Advising and Student Transitions
Additional Information can be found at: https://huskiesconnect.stcloudstate.edu/event/3292824

vevents.description:
Students who complete the Accuplacer Review Session from 3 - 4 pm will be eligible to retake the Accuplacer assessment. Students whose new scores bump them into a higher level course will work with academic advisors to adjust their schedule. The Accuplacer is an untimed\, computerized exam.

Please bring your SCSU Student ID card\, or other official photo ID and your SCSU ID number.

This event is by invite only\;check your HuskyNet email account to see if you qualify.
Hosted by: Advising and Student Transitions\, Academic Learning Center 
Additional Information can be found at: https://huskiesconnect.stcloudstate.edu/event/3373237

All new students who are living on campus are required to attend their first Floor Meeting. Meet your Community Advisor (CA)\, get connected to all of your other floor mates\, and get the information on housing policies & opportunities.
Students will walk with their floor mates and CA down to our first campus-wide Huskies 1st Four event.
Hosted by: Advising and Student Transitions
Additional Information can be found at: https://huskiesconnect.stcloudstate.edu/event/3295581

Join us on the football field for a welcome from Mayor Kleis\, dancing with President Wacker\, cheers with our Spirit Groups\, and challenges with our student-athletes. This event kicks off the Huskies 1st Four Days with activities\, prizes\, and a tradition of fun!
All students should bring their student ID card for attendance. We suggest wearing SCSU gear or red & black to this high energy event.
Students living on-campus will walk to the event with their Community Advisor (CA). Commuter students can park in the Husky Pay Lot or K Lot for this event.
Doors open at 8:00 pm.

Hosted by: Advising and Student Transitions\, Campus Recreation\, Huskies Athletics\, Student Athlete Advisory Committee 
Additional Information can be found at: https://huskiesconnect.stcloudstate.edu/event/3372545

President Wacker and Provost Gregory invite all new undergraduate students to New Student Convocation\, your official welcome to St. Cloud State and the introduction to academic life and expectations at the University. Students will wear their Orientation t-shirts\, learn important university traditions\, be introduced to the many academic opportunities available to all SCSU students.
Bring your student ID card as attendance will be taken.
Parents and family members can watch the program online through our Live Stream program.

Additional Information can be found at: https://huskiesconnect.stcloudstate.edu/event/3986815

Be part of the TV Magic! 
UTVS is the student-ran television station that serves over 30\,000 homes in the St. Cloud area.
UTVS produces live weekday newscasts in addition to many other live and pre-recorded content including entertainment\, sports\, and special event coverage!

Join our organization!
Your first step is coming to our General Meeting. This is where you can learn all about what UTVS has to offer and to meet peers that have similar interests!
Pizza and drinks will be served starting at 6:00!

The St. Cloud State School of Graduate Studies is delighted to announce the return of the Graduate School Fair in 2019.
Come and learn about graduate programs\, admission requirements\, and more!
A full list of attending universities and programs will be available soon athttps://www.stcloudstate.edu/graduatestudies/default.aspx

Prepare for the fair!

Review websites of schools with programs of interest to you
Target specific schools and programs

SCSU welcomes all Band Alumni to a reception starting at 7pm on Friday\, Sept. 27 at Beaver Island Brewerys taproom downtown St. Cloud. The reception is partof the overall SCSU Homecomingweekend.
There areonline registrations for specific reunions taking place that weekend. One of the links is just for band so we can track instruments (and if someone needs to borrow one)\, music part\, t-shirt size\, etc. We am working on getting a branded/shortened link from ITS\, but for now\, the link to this site is https://engage.tassl.com/event/2250 and it will be live in a few days. If you have questions about the Band Alumni Reception\, contact John Brown with University Advancement at (320) 308-1668 or email: jmbrown@stcloudstate.edu.
Please check back for further updates.
Go Huskies!!!
Hosted by: Alumni Relations\, Department of Music\, School of the Arts
Additional Information can be found at: https://huskiesconnect.stcloudstate.edu/event/3870854

It's time to save the date for St. Cloud State University Homecoming\, happening September 25-28\, 2019. As a part of this year's festivities\, we'll once again be hosting a reunion for band alumni. This is a chance to dust off your instrument\, bring it back to campus and play alongside our Husky Sports Band\, just for ol' time's sake!This year's celebration will take place on campus September 25-28\, 2019. As a Band alum\, you're invited to attend a special band gathering on Friday\, September 27th and join the Husky Sports Band as they perform at the Huskies Football game on Saturday\, September 28th!

Friday: Band Alumni Reception\, Beaver Island Taproom\, 216 6th Avenue South\, 7:00 p.m.
Saturday: Band Alumni perform with Husky Sports Band at Huskies Football game\, Husky Stadium\, 5:00 p.m. (Rehearsal time and location TBD and will be announced this summer)Don't forget to visit Huskies Fan Fest from 2:00  5:00 p.m. in the Husky Pay Lot with food\, games and entertainment before the Huskies Football game!

Plus\, we're planning a variety of activities to get you reconnected with old friends\, colleagues\, faculty and staffall in the backdrop of Central Minnesota's spectacular fall colors.
Come immerse yourself in the spirit of being a Husky at Homecoming 2019. This is a celebration you don't want to miss!
When you register at https://engage.tassl.com/event/2250 be sure to select the Register as an Alumni Band Member option!
Go Huskies!!!
Hosted by: Alumni Relations\, Department of Music\, School of the Arts
Additional Information can be found at: https://huskiesconnect.stcloudstate.edu/event/3920518
